descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: French 111-2 is the second quarter of Elementary French. Class meets four days a week. The aim of the course is to build skills in speaking, listening, writing and reading French through study, practice, and class activities.

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value: French 111-1 or department placement. No PN allowed. Attendance at first class is mandatory.

descriptions.name: Teaching Method
descriptions.value: Classes will include a variety of activities designed to help students acquire a knowledge of basic French vocabulary and structures along with the ability to use what they have learned in situations of communication. Classes will be conducted in French except when explanation of grammar or other material may necessitate the use of English. Students are expected to prepare outside of class, to participate actively in class activities, and to work independently with the En Avant! listening program and Internet activities.

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value: Final grades are based on class performance and attendance, homework and compositions, quizzes, 3 tests, and a final oral exam.

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value: Required text(s): Anderson, Golato and Blatty. En Avant!,second edition. (with Connect access card)
